ygData.messageBody:
I believe as of the last patch that exp loss due to player DoT has changed.
. . probably some how in conjunction with them 'fixing' the DoT bug (that I
hear is still not completely fixed). . . . anyway, while I haven't tested
it, the lastest word is that when a player dies from another player's DoT,
it does not result in an exp loss.

Kassao, Level 19 Half Elf Bard
Mizst, Level 39 Dark Elf Necromancer
Tarew Marr

p.s. I'd wish I could give you more hard info on the DoT's but ever since
15th level or so, I haven't been able to stop playing my bard. =)



>From: <kim@...>
>Ouch. DDD and CoD are DoTs. If they work like other DoTs and
>end up killing your friend while dueling, the game will
>consider it a DoT kill and not a duel kill, and they will lose
>experience. Be careful when doing this folks! Maybe some of
>you L2-5 folks may want to test it for us with CoD.
>
